title: UCSF COVID-19 Vaccine Information
cleaned_text: Updated July 11, 2023 UCSF Vaccinations The information on this page is directed to UCSF faculty, staff and learners and Benioff Children's Hospitals faculty. For patient information on vaccination eligibility, appointments and locations, visit: -------- Current policies remain in place for UCSF faculty, staff, learners, and patients and visitors, including UCSF Benioff Children's Hospital Oakland. - UCSF facility, staff, and learners are required to [receive the COVID-19 bivalent booster shot (if eligible), or formally opt out](https://chancellor.ucsf.edu/blog/action-required-covid-19-bivalent-booster-shots), by Feb. 1, 2023. Review these [bivalent booster frequently asked questions](https://ucsf.app.box.com/file/1110440866307?s=9fx0fgvgumacqam9498m5tz49sgcpibs). - Upload proof of that record to the [Occupational Health Services portal](https://ohsportal.ucsfmedicalcenter.org/)(UCSF MyAccess is required.) Those who cannot connect to VPN should send the document to [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#3f495e5c5c56515a6d5a4c4f50514c565d535a505959565c5a7f4a5c4c59115a5b4a). - Upload proof of that record to the - UCSF Benioff Children's Hospital Oakland employees can [receive the bivalent booster at the Outpatient Center](https://www.ucsfbenioffchildrens.org/education/covid-19-vaccine)on the main campus and should submit documentation to Employee Health at [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#43262b6e2726333703362030256d262736). - To be eligible for the updated booster shots, you must have completed your primary vaccination series — and be at least two months out from your last dose of any COVID vaccine, [according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)](https://www.fda.gov/news-events/press-announcements/coronavirus-covid-19-update-fda-authorizes-moderna-pfizer-biontech-bivalent-covid-19-vaccines-use). If you've recently had COVID-19, you should be fully recovered before getting your updated booster shot. - For additional information on COVID-19 treatments, [visit](/www.ucsfhealth.org/education/covid-19-medicines-that-can-help) [COVID-19 Medicines That Can Help](https://www.ucsfhealth.org/education/covid-19-medicines-that-can-help). Schedule an Appointment at UCSF Vaccination Locations We encourage you to schedule an appointment for vaccines and booster shots at a UCSF Health vaccination location. - UCSF employees (and new hires) can obtain a COVID-19 vaccine at Occupational Health Services (OHS) at Mount Zion at 2330 Post St., Suite 460, San Francisco. Information on additional locations and hours of operation is posted on the [OHS website](https://occupationalhealthprogram.ucsf.edu/covid-19-information-and-resources). Appointments are strongly recommended and can be made through [MyChart](https://www.ucsfhealth.org/mychart) or by calling OHS at 415-885-7580. Please bring proof of vaccination if given outside our system. Patients 6 months to 17 years old must be accompanied by a parent or caregiver. - UCSF Fresno Mobile HeaL COVID-19 Equity Project drive-through location is closed. Testing, vaccines, and treatments will continue to be available on a mobile basis. For more information, [visit UCSF Fresno Mobile HeaL](https://www.fresno.ucsf.edu/mobileheal/), call or text (559) 349-8082, or email: [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#f6939b979f9ad3b3c4d3cec6d3b7b0908493859899db9b99949f9a939e93979ab683958590d8939283). Schedule an Appointment at Non-UCSF Locations To schedule an appointment outside UCSF, visit your pharmacy's website, your county's vaccine website, California's [My Turn](https://myturn.ca.gov/), or the national [Vaccines.gov](http://vaccines.gov/) site.
